TITLE –Developer (Network Support) - Senior

SCOPE

We are looking for a passionate Senior Developer to join our team who has experience working with Network and Webseal appliances. As a Senior Developer in our company, they will have the opportunity to work on new and exciting projects in a fully Agile/Scrum team environment.

Reporting to the Business Solution Delivery Development Lead for the Platform and Channel sub-domain, the Senior Developer will have a diversified role supporting our applications and our network in accordance with application development standards and best practices, while working on projects, change requests, minor enhancements and defect resolution and network support. The candidate will be working on the Website Technical team, providing support network support, working with our Webseal appliances, and Nginx Reverse Proxy.

He or she will be responsible for analyzing, developing and delivering technical solutions for the Platform and Channel sub-domain that satisfy the business requirements, and align with enterprise architecture. The Senior Developer will also work with incident management teams to investigate and resolve issues and defects with various applications. We are an Agile organization, so previous exposure to Agile/Scrum methodologies is a big plus.

DUTIES

Work collaboratively with clients and co-workers to define product requirements and technical solutions
Understand the work packages/user stories and provide work effort estimates to the Project Manager
Develop, integrate, test, maintain and enhance existing and proprietary platform solutions
Work on the team that supports our network appliances, Webseal and Nginx reverse proxy solutions
Provide support for our project teams and support teams by helping with all network requirements for applications
Prepare and implement the technical solution to the production environment
Investigate and provide post implementation support of the technical solution implemented
Assist in developing technical documentation

DURATION AND POTENTIAL START DATE

Initial offering is for 1 year with a potential for renewal for a second year. Tentative start date would be October 10th or as soon as candidate is available.

Skills And Experiences

Our Requirements

7+ Years of industry experience working with and understanding network traffic flow
7+ Working with Nginx and Webseal
This role requires very strong Critical thinking and problem solving
Strong experience and knowledge of Design and Architectural patterns and knows when to apply them.
A focus on delivering results with benefits to the customer
Experience working in an Agile Team environment as well as work independently
A champion who undertakes new approaches and helps transform our technological capabilities
Comfortable in a dynamic environment with multiple concurrent priorities
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to communicate technical solutions at all org. levels
Ability to learn quickly, work across full stack and in a fast-paced environment
Ability to understanding existing application by reading source code with minimal documents
Team player, leader and mentor
Key contributor to design and implementation of projects with varying complexity

Must have

7+ years’ experience working with Network traffic flow
7+ years’ experience with Nginx
7+ years’ experience with Webseal
5+ years’ experience with Network Security
5+ years’ experience working with RDBMS, SQL, Oracle. etc.
5+ years’ experience working with Java application servers (WebLogic, Tomcat, etc.)
5+ years’ experience with Web Service/API technologies REST/SOAP, Swagger2,
Experience with source version control, build and dependency management tools (Git, Maven, etc.)

Nice to have

Knowledge of Akamai
Experience with XLST
Secure coding practices, including spring security, and knowledge of common OWASP security findings
Experience with CI/CD best practices and tools such as Jenkins, Microservices, OpenShift, SonarQube etc.
Current with latest technology, trends, and best practices

LOCATION OF WORK

Ottawa or Toronto, no preference. Able to come on site. Once a month there are events if contractor can join. Not mandatory.

HOURS OF WORK

37.5 hours per week, 9am – 5pm
